intro: Bupleurum triradiatum, commonly known as the three-rayed bupleurum, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Bupleurum triradiatum is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal medicine.
